result.execSummary:
The defendant Vincent M Zima was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Failure to Support Child (120 Days+), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.22(2).
  • Failure to Support Child (120 Days+), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.22(2).
  • Failure to Support Child (120 Days+), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.22(2).
  • Failure to Support Child (120 Days+), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.22(2).
  • Failure to Support Child (120 Days+), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.22(2).
  • Failure to Support Child (120 Days+), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.22(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: To pay the costs of the action on all counts including extradition fees.   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Remain current with child support payments and pay all arrears. Keep Child Support Agency informed of any change of address, employer, phone number within 48 hours of the change.

Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment.   Defendant must have a DNA sample on file with the State of Wisconsin and pay a DNA surcharge.
Not to have any additional children until arrears are paid in full.

Defendant Vincent M Zima appears by phone along with attorney Debra Rose Mancoske who appears in person.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court reviews events in file. Court questions defendant on why he's not in court in person. Defendant indicates his car is still being worked on, he borrowed a vehicle and will be here in about an hour. State requests a bench warrant. Atty Mancoske asks court to reschedule matter to 3:00 this afternoon. Court indicates they are not available after 2:30 today. Court orders bench warrant. Atty Mancoske asks court not to forfeit the signature bond. Court not doing anything with bond until a motion is filed.

Defendant Vincent M Zima appears by phone along with attorney Debra Rose Mancoske who appears in person.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court reviews events in file. Atty Mancoske advises defendant's car broke down in Chicago. Defendant indicates his head gasket blew and he's still sitting in Chicago.  Atty Mancoske requests another sentencing date. State requests bench warrant, asks court to reinstate the $5,000 cash bond. Court reschedules matter. If defendant doesn't appear on 10/16/15, court will be issuing a warrant for his arrest. Bond remains in effect.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 16, 2015 at 11:45 am.

State/Defense ready to proceed to sentencing without the benefit of a PSI.  Atty Mancoske asks court to set off sentencing until after 10/04/15 to allow defendant time to obtain some money to be applied toward restitution. State objects to adjournment. Discussion regarding payment of restitution. Court grants one last adjournment. Bond remains in effect.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 12, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Vincent M Zima in court with attorney Debra Rose Mancoske.  Defendant Vincent M Zima in custody.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file.   Minute sheet. State gives plea agreement.  Court questions defendant on change of plea.  Rights/elements/max. penalties reviewed with defendant.  Defendant enters no contest plea with Cts. 3, 4, 10, 11, 12 & 13.  Defense stipulates to factual basis to accept plea.  Court finds pleas made freely, knowingly and voluntarily, accepts pleas, and finds guilty of Cts. 3, 4, 10, 11, 12 & 13. Court dismisses remaining counts but reads in for sentencing.   Court reviews collateral consequences of felony conviction, possible penalties. Defendant must have a DNA sample on file with the State of Wisconsin. State/Defense are not requesting a PSI in this matter. Court amends cash bond to a signature bond.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 10, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Vincent M Zima in court with attorney Debra Rose Mancoske.  Defendant Vincent M Zima in custody.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file, addresses Defendant's motion for bond modification. Atty Mancoske asks court to reduce $1,500 cash bond to $750 to allow defendant to return to Indiana for work and to attend school. State objects to reduction of cash bond, bond was already reduced from $5,000 to $1,500. State feels bond presently set by the court is appropriate. Atty Mancoske gives statement on bond reduction. State continues their objection. Court makes statement, not reducing cash bond, remains at $1,500.
Defendant's Motion for Reduction of Bail
Bail/Bond Review at 05-19-2015 03:30 pm
Cash bond reduced from $5,000 to $1,500.  Same conditions apply.

Atty Mancoske makes statement on bond, asks court to convert cash bond to a signature bond so defendant can be released and return to Indiana to attend school and work. State objects to court converting cash bond to a signature bond, feels cash bond is appropriate. Court agrees some cash is necessary, reduces $5,000 to $1,500. Same conditions apply.
Defense waives reading of Information and enters not guilty plea.
State's Discovery Demand
Defense waives right to Prelim. Court questions defendant on waiver. Court finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver and binds over for trial. Court finds probable cause for bindover.

Atty Gerbers indicates that Atty Debra Mancoske has been appointed to represent defendant but she wasn't available today. Atty Gerbers will sit in for Initial Appearance.
